page.title: 02THE STREET FAIR 29/06/85
page.content:
On Saturday 29th June in Winsham there was a special day.It was the 300th anniversary of the Monmouth Rebellion.On Friday we raked up the grass on the Recreation Ground and some people put up some Fairground rides.There even was a thatched roof on the Telephone Box.Early in the morning people put up their stalls.Everyone was supposed to wear 17th century costume.I was in a play called "The Winsham Rebels".I was one of the Maids of Taunton.The school had a 17th Century display .There were Ploughman's Lunches in the Jubilee Hall.My Mum had a Strawberries and cream stall.There were lots of other stalls and 17th Century Football on the field.It was a great day.
By Eleanor Payne
